title: Stafford shows 'MVP stuff' in Rams' clinching drive
content: Matthew Stafford led the Rams to a 34-31 victory over the Panthers on Saturday with a seven-play, 71-yard drive that ended with a touchdown pass to tight end Colby Parkinson.

title: Harbaugh to limit interviews to just a few teams
content: Former Ravens coach John Harbaugh will narrow his options to just a few NFL teams before starting to take interviews for his next potential job, he told Fox Sports.

title: Sources: Yankees, Bellinger talks at an impasse
content: Contract negotiations between the New York Yankees and Cody Bellinger are at an impasse, league sources tell ESPN.

title: Schroder suspended for trying to strike Doncic
content: Kings point guard Dennis Schroder was suspended three games for confronting and attempting to hit Luka Doncic after a loss to the Lakers on Dec. 28.

title: Optimistic Panthers show fight, focus on future
content: Despite an  8-9 regular-season record, the Carolina Panthers, double-digit underdogs Saturday in the NFC wild-card round, took the Los Angeles Rams to the final seconds at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte before ultimately succumbing in a 34-31 loss.

title: Wisconsin hands No. 2 Michigan first loss of year
content: John Blackwell, Nick Boyd and Aleksas Bieliauskas combined for 65 points to lead Wisconsin to a 91-88 upset of No. 2 Michigan, the Wolverines first loss of the season.

title: Stafford, Garrett, Nacua top NFL All-Pro Team
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett, Puka Nacua and Jaxon Smith-Njigba headline the 2025 Associated Press NFL All-Pro Team.

title: USMNT's Pepi suffers broken arm scoring for PSV
content: United States striker Ricardo Pepi suffered a broken forearm while in action for PSV Eindhoven on Saturday and and is set to be sidelined for two months, the Dutch club has confirmed..

title: Overreactions, big questions off NFL wild-card games: Did the Panthers expose issues for the Rams?
content: Do the Rams have secondary problems? Will Bryce Young get paid big money? We're making sense of each game in the NFL playoffs wild-card round.

title: Our guide to four remaining wild-card games: Matchup previews, bold predictions, more
content: Bills-Jaguars? Niners-Eagles? Chargers-Pats? Texans-Steelers? We have picks, predictions and stats to know.

title: FA Cup biggest shock ever: Macclesfield stun holders Palace
content: In a competition known for shocking results, the FA Cup produced its biggest Saturday in its 154-year history.

title: 'Not sure why they felt the need': NBA execs on the Trae deal and trade season's next move
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Men's: A weak nonconference slate could doom Georgia
content: The Bulldogs are a few SEC losses away from the wrong side of the bubble due to a number of low-quality wins.

title: Women's: Why LSU's seed could be determined in the next two games
content: LSU has work to do after its 0-2 start in SEC play, but opportunity arrives with the season's most crucial two-game stretch.

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams: Key free agents, draft outlook, priorities and predictions
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 19 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Inside Washington's quiet collapse in 2025 and the decisions defining its offseason
content: Parting ways with Kliff Kingsbury was a bold move that raised the stakes for Dan Quinn & Co. this offseason.

title: From future HOF pitchers to a veteran catcher: Best fits for under-the-radar MLB free agents
content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: Supercopa Clasico preview, predictions: Are Barcelona favorites vs. Real Madrid?
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid meet in the Supercopa final on Sunday, but who has the upper hand? Sam Marsden and Alex Kirkland preview the upcoming Clasico.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: 'We're all using it as motivation': LSU aims to shake off last season and win again
content: Last year, the defending champion Tigers were edged out of finals. Now they're back -- with a plan to win the national title again.

title: Jaguars' all teal, Panthers' all black lead NFL wild-card weekend uniforms
content: The NFL's wild-card round kicks off Saturday with multiple teams opting for traditional uniform combinations.

title: NFL wild-card round: Expect a tight game between 49ers and Eagles
content: Odds, game picks, prop plays, betting advice and daily fantasy tips for the 49ers-Eagles wild-card matchup.

title: The 2026 championship parlays: From conservative plays to huge potential payouts
content: We go on record picking this year's champions, beginning with the CFP and ending with the World Series.

title: In Frames: Kathputli — pulling strings in Jaipur’s puppet colony
content: In this Jaipur corner, nearly 250 families carry forward one of Rajasthan’s oldest folk art forms, Kathputli; these artisans sew bright costumes onto small wooden puppets that are used by travelling performers who narrate tales of Rajput kings, warriors, folk heroes, and moral stories

title: MLA Rahul Mamkootathil arrested from hotel room in Palakkad
content: Around midnight on January 10, the police team surprised Mr. Mamkootathil by waking him from his room number 2002 and placing him under arrest

title: Flag bearers of secularism silent on violence in Bangladesh, says U.P. CM Yogi
content: The U.P. CM added those dividing society today can never be well-wishers of the nation and cautioned people from opposition parties

title: Junior hockey coach arrested for raping minor in Haryana’s Rewari
content: The victim said that she became pregnant due to the rape and on January 5, she suffered a miscarriage and was admitted to a hospital by her family after her health deteriorated

title: BJP and JD(S) accuse Congress of misleading people on VB-G RAM G scheme, welcome special session
content: The alliance partners said they would take the issue to the village level to counter the ‘misinformation’ being spread by the Congress

title: Blogger missing for a week, family appeals CM for help
content: Pranab Das, 23, a resident of Malaya Nagar Nepali Para under the Srinagar police station limits in West Tripura district, has remained untraced since January 3

title: January weather system to influence heavy rainfall in parts of coastal districts on Sunday
content: Coastal places like Chennai experienced nippy weather, strong surface winds interspersed with light rainfall on Saturday owing to the wind influence that brought moisture from Bay of Bengal

title: Why was bail denied to Umar and Sharjeel? | Explained
content: Why did the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act bail bar prevail against Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam? Why were the two student activists on a ‘qualitatively different footing’, according to the top court? How does the verdict mark a departure from judicial precedent?

title: INDIA bloc taking contradictory positions on SIR, says BJP
content: BJP MP and national spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said that the Opposition parties seemed unsure about their own position, with their leaders changing their claims about the impact of the exercise

title: Forest teams monitor movement of elephants in Vellore
content: The drive comes in the wake of a herd of elephants reportedly destroying large tracts of farmlands in areas like Rajiv Gandhi Nagar and Indira Nagar near Panamadangi RF for the past few days

title: Majnu Komath, architect of struggle for Goshree Bridges, passes away
content: He served as chairman of the Ernakulam-Vypeen Bridges Action Council, formed in the 1980s, and remained steadfast in the struggle until the bridges became a reality in 2004

title: Congress does not believe in ‘backdoor politics’, says Selvaperunthagai
content: Clarifying the party’s position on alliances, he says seat-sharing talks in Tamil Nadu are being handled by a committee appointed by the party high command and led by Girish Chodankar

title: Anbumani urges T.N. government to hold talks with Livelihood Mission workers, fill headmaster vacancies
content: The PMK leader says the workers’ repeated demands for salary revision and service regularisation have been ignored, forcing them to launch a sit-in protest

title: Stalin urges Modi to consult States before finalising caste enumeration rules for Census
content: Caste enumeration is a sensitive matter that touches upon deep-rooted social dynamics and has the potential to cause unintended societal tensions if not handled with utmost care, says T.N. Chief Minister

title: Set aside political differences for development of capital city: Governor
content: Meeting with Thiruvananthapuram Corporation councillors, Rajendra Arlekar underscores the importance of dedication and efficient implementation for development

title: Avakai–Amaravati festival concludes on grand note in Vijayawada
content: Three-day celebration of cinema, culture and literature draws over 7,000 visitors on final day; next edition set for December 2026

title: Students shocked over closing of Vaishno Devi medical college in Jammu over ‘poor infrastructure’
content: The Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Medical College, one of the ambitious projects of J&K, registered its first batch on the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) ranking in October-November 2024; out of 50 MBBS seats, 42 Muslim students, mostly from Kashmir, qualified for the college

title: Centre to focus on 100 high-risk districts to cut road accident deaths
content: Zero-fatalities programme has already been rolled out in 20 districts in Uttar Pradesh, 19 in Tamil Nadu, 11 in Maharashtra, and nine in Karnataka

title: Somnath is symbol of ‘civilisational courage’, says PM Modi
content: Starting his three-day visit to Gujarat, PM Modi witnessed a drone show and presided over a meeting of the Shree Somnath Trust as its chairman

title: Naidu vows to bring world’s top universities to Amaravati
content: Chief Minister says capital already hosts reputed private universities, highlights focus on quantum, AI and higher education growth at Siddhartha Academy golden jubilee celebrations

title: Self-reliance in defence is crucial for India’s strategic autonomy: Defence Secretary
content: ‘Evolving global supply chains and rapidly advancing technologies present both challenges and unprecedented opportunities for India’s defence sector,’ says Rajesh Kumar Singh

title: Congress launches 45-day ‘MGNREGA Bachao Sangram’ against new rural jobs legislation
content: The campaign seeks the restoration of MGNREGA in its original form as a rights-based legislation guaranteeing employment, strengthening the role of panchayats, and ensuring accountability

title: China will have half of newly-diagnosed Parkinson’s disease cases in the next decade: Nobel Laureate
content: In 2030, it is estimated that 8.7 million individuals will be affected by Parkinson’s, of which 57% will be from China, 14% from Europe, 8% from India, 7% from the U.S., 4% from Brazil, and 10% others

title: At pre-Budget meet, Thangam Thennarasu flags GST losses, seeks release of pending dues
content: He also urges the Centre to reconsider the Metro Rail proposals for Madurai and Coimbatore, saying that the grounds cited for their rejection were inconsistent with those cited for the approval granted to the projects in other cities

title: AAP holds protests in Punjab against circulation of Atishi's 'doctored' video
content: An FIR has been registered in the matter, and a forensic examination ‘confirmed deliberate manipulation’ of the clip, the party says

title: Eminent citizens being harassed during SIR, Mamata writes again to CEC
content: It is a matter of profound shame that Nobel Laureate Prof. Amartya Sen-a nonagenarian and a globally respected intellectual, has been asked to appear before ECI officials to establish his credentials, Ms . Banerjee wrote in the letter

title: Eighth airport of Andhra Pradesh to come up at Dagadarthi
content: Request for Proposal has been issued to invite private participation for development, operation, and maintenance under a long-term concession framework

title: Elderly people share slew of concerns as govt. panel seeks to set priorities
content: Over 150 people representing senior citizen forums and voluntary organisations put together their concerns and suggestions at a hearing held by the Kerala State Elderly Commission

title: Police foil Somasila visit, place YSRCP leaders under house arrest
content: Kakani Govardhan Reddy accuses CM N. Chandrababu Naidu of secret Telangana pact over scrapped Rayalaseema irrigation scheme

title: UDF, BJP campaign against Left over Sabarimala lost its relevance, says CPI
content: The party said the State government has fully cooperated with the investigation; those who tried to steal the wealth of the temple should be treated as culprits

title: Consider Romeo-Juliet clause in POCSO to protect adolescent relationships, Supreme Court tells Centre
content: Abuse of POCSO, especially by families objecting to romantic involvement among teenagers, has become common, says court; orders the judgment copy to be given to Law Secretary to take steps to ‘curb this menace’

title: SIT conducts protracted search and seizure operation at Sabarimala senior Tantri’s private residence in Chengannur
content: Officials say the SIT reportedly focussed on creating an inventory of artefacts, including gold ornaments, in Rajeevaru’s possession to audit their provenance and confiscate the objects, including bank statements and legal documents, pertaining to the case

title: A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan urges doctors to visit tribal pockets once a month
content: Pawan performs bhumi puja for construction of buildings and labs at Rangaraya Medical College and lauds alumni for raising  ₹11.10 crore for the purpose

title: Union Budget 2026-27: Kerala’s wish-list includes ‘Special Fiscal Correction Package,’ defence innovation corridor, revenue protection measures under GST
content: State reiterates demand for AIIMS, Sabari Rail, special package for return migrants and aid for paddy and rubber sectors

title: Balan refuses to apologise to Jamaat-e-Islami
content: Jamaat-e-Islami had sent the senior CPI(M) leader a legal notice against defamatory remarks, seeking an apology and ₹1 crore in compensation

title: Centre should share surcharge collections with States: Bhatti
content: Mr. Bhatti Vikramarka made a strong pitch for enhanced fiscal space for States, greater devolution of resources and early sanction of major infrastructure projects

title: Manipur fuel outlets shut down demanding security after bomb attacks
content: In a letter to Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla, the State’s petroleum dealers said they have been facing severe threats despite steps taken for their safety

title: Palliative care needs to be integrated into dentistry, says M.R. Rajagopal
content: Pallium India has launched a new Department of Palliative Care Dentistry in Thiruvananthapuram, aimed at addressing the often-overlooked oral health challenges faced by head and neck cancer survivors.

title: CWC orders probe into allegation of teacher’s sexual abuse of students
content: The police arrested the teacher after he allegedly abused a Class VI student at his quarters, reportedly after giving the child liquor

title: ONGC completes capping of Mori-5 well in Konaseema in five days
content: A major blowout of natural gas was reported in Mori-5 well during workover activity aimed at increasing the flow of the natural gas on January 5

title: One dead, six hospitalised after inhaling carbon monoxide in Dharwad
content: The incident came to light after their colleague visited their room to check after repeated calls went unanswered

title: Arrangements in place for Makaravilakku festival
content: Virtual Queue bookings capped at 35,000 for January 13 and 30,000 for January 14, the festival day. Only those with valid Virtual Queue bookings will be allowed darshan, say police. As part of traffic management, restrictions will be imposed on pilgrims’ movement

title: ISRO’s Aditya-L1 decodes how solar storms impact Earth’s magnetic field
content: The study used observations from Aditya-L1, India’s first solar observatory, along with data from other international space missions to decode the impact of a massive eruption of solar plasma from the Sun

title: CPI(M), Congress, and BJP draw battle lines over Sabarimala theft, Jamaat-e-Islami Hind, and religious fundamentalism
content: CPI(M) will launch mass movement against schismatic politics, BJP will observe Makaravilakku season as faith protection month, while Congress will spotlight LDF’s ‘rightward drift to Hindutva politics’

title: Quack arrested in Tirupattur
content: A special medical team conducted a surprise check in the house after health officials got complaints from residents

title: NH-65 under drone surveillance as Sankranti traffic from Hyderabad peaks
content: Panthangi Toll Plaza, which typically handles between 15,000 and 20,000 vehicles a day, is seeing a a fourfold rise in traffic as festive travel surges

title: Recon Expo 2026 receives a good response
content: Recon Expo 2026, projected as North Karnataka’s largest interior design and construction materials exhibition, which began in Hubballi on Friday and witnessed a higher visitor turnout on Saturday.

title: RPF seize 21 kg ganja at Jolarpet railway station
content: The team searched coaches of the express train where they found two abandoned tourist bags in the luggage carrier of the general compartment

title: India should design and manufacture 70% of products made here over the next 10 years, say experts
content: IIT professors, research leaders call for support to Indian students and scientists to convert their ideas into successful commercial products at webinar organised by SASTRA, The Hindu Education Plus

title: Blast at fireworks factory in Bengal’s Champahati leaves four severely injured
content: Local police and firefighters reached the spot and doused the flames, rescued the locals, and started investigating the cause of the fire; the blast site was sealed off to secure the location.

title: Minister Duraimurugan distributes free laptops for students at Katpadi
content: Tiruvannamalai has the highest number of 5,102 beneficiaries, followed by Vellore, Ranipet, and Tirupattur

title: Complaint against seven employees of ICFRE–IWST for securing govt. jobs through forgery and impersonation
content: During internal scrutiny at the IWST, discrepancies were noticed between the handwriting, signatures, attendance sheets, OMR answer sheets, admit cards and service records of the accused employees

title: Lack of port-driven industrial ecosystem deprives Kerala from tapping Vizhinjam’s potential
content: The seaport has once again emerged as the top-performing port on the east and south coasts of India, registering a container throughput of 1.21 lakh twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) in December 2025

title: CREDAI property show sees rising footfalls on Day 2 in Vijayawada
content: About 2,000 visitors have attended the three-day event so far as organisers expect turnout to reach 5,000 by the final day amid cautious optimism in the real estate sector

title: ‘Generals trying to deflect him’: Trump orders Greenland invasion plan — what we know
content: Trump’s interest in Greenland may also be driven by domestic political considerations. With mid-term elections approaching later this year, there is concern that the president may seek a dramatic foreign policy move to divert attention from the US economy, amid fears Republicans could lose control of Congress to Democrats," the Mail reported, citing British diplomatic sources.

title: Operation Hawkeye Strike: Video shows glimpse of US action in Syria; ISIS targets hit — watch
content: US forces launched significant strikes across Syria targeting ISIS, a retaliatory move for a deadly December 13th ambush in Palmyra. The operation, named 'Hawkeye Strike,' directly responds to an ISIS attack that claimed the lives of two American soldiers and a civilian interpreter. This action underscores the US commitment to eradicating terrorist threats and protecting its personnel in the region.

title: Drunk Bengaluru techie arrested after crashing into wall of Barbeque Nation; close shave for 6 people
content: A drunk software engineer narrowly missed hitting six pedestrians on a Bengaluru footpath when he lost control of his car and crashed into a restaurant wall. The 42-year-old techie, returning from a party, jumped a median and sped towards the Barbeque Nation restaurant. One person sustained injuries, and two vehicles were damaged in the incident.

title: 'Agar maar padh bhi jaati': Virat Kohli's powerful message to net bowler goes viral —watch
content: Virat Kohli's leadership shone during India's training camp as he motivated a local net bowler, emphasising conviction in bowling.  After an intense session, Kohli offered encouragement and signed a ball, demonstrating his commitment to developing talent and his own sharp form ahead of the ODI series.

title: Cash cow: Gaumutra–gobar cancer project turns scam in MP; Rs 3.5 crore under lens
content: A state-funded research initiative at Nanaji Deshmukh Veterinary Science University, aimed at using cow dung, urine, and milk to combat cancer, has allegedly devolved into a financial scandal. An investigation revealed significant misuse of research funds, with money reportedly spent on unrelated expenses like air travel and vehicle purchases, while research output remains minimal.

title: Microsoft AI CEO: We're building superintelligence backwards; need controls before trust
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: Panic in Himachal: Tunnel work cracks Shimla homes; 15 families evacuated at 10 pm in 1°C
content: Two residential buildings were evacuated near Shimla's Sanjauli after cracks appeared, allegedly due to tunnelling work. Around 40 people from 15 families were displaced amid freezing temperatures. Authorities suspended traffic on the bypass and initiated damage assessment and compensation processes.

title: 'ICE out for good’: Demonstrations erupt across the US after Renee Nicole Good’s fatal shooting
content: Protests erupted across the United States following the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. Demonstrations, organized under the banner "ICE out for good," occurred in major cities and small towns, fueled by videos of the incident and differing accounts from state and federal officials.

title: 'I am pained by ...': Delhi CM Rekha Gupta on memes targeting her; what she said
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta expressed pain over AAP members using her verbal slips to attack her, alleging they cannot tolerate a woman leading the government. She also criticized Arvind Kejriwal's past promises and the transition to the 'Sheesh Mahal', while highlighting the government's efforts in public transport and pollution control.

title: Amazon's remote work offer: H-1B employees can stay in India, but they cannot do these 11 jobs
content: Amazon is allowing employees stranded in India due to H-1B visa delays to work remotely until March 2. However, strict restrictions prevent them from coding, making strategic decisions, or interacting with customers. These limitations, reportedly due to local laws, significantly hinder core job functions, leaving many engineers questioning their productivity.

title: 'The Raja Saab' Box Office, Day 2: Prabhas film sees big drop
content: Prabhas's 'The Raja Saab' experienced a significant box office drop on its second day, earning Rs 27.83 crore after a strong opening. The film has garnered Rs 90.73 crore net in India and Rs 138.4 crore worldwide in two days. While Telugu collections are robust, other language performances are lagging, and audience reviews highlight issues with storytelling and execution.

title: Did ICC suggest Hyderabad, Chennai as alternate venues to Bangladesh? BCB reveals
content: The concerns were raised after Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman was released by IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on the instructions of the BCCI for unspecified reasons. This came amid reports of attacks on minorities in Bangladesh.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page 'cutting ties' with America's Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Dalit woman’s killer arrested in Haridwar; abducted daughter found
content: Police apprehended the alleged killer of a Dalit woman in Haridwar two days after her murder and her daughter's abduction in Meerut. The daughter was safely recovered. Political leaders attempting to visit the aggrieved family were reportedly stopped by security forces, while BJP politicians were allowed access.

title: ‘They want to demolish BJP’: Bengal LoP accuses TMC workers of attacking his convoy; sits on dharna
content: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari sat on a protest inside the Chandrakona police station, demanding registration of an FIR after he alleged that his convoy was attacked by Trinamool Congress workers at Paschim Medinipur on Saturday night.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier x Hockey Canada collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: 'Administered medicine through cannula': Chilling details pour out in Bengaluru doctor murder
content: Bengaluru police have filed a 2,322-page chargesheet against surgeon Dr. Mahendra Reddy in connection with his wife Dr. Krutika Reddy's death. Key evidence includes the accused's confession of administering medicine, traces of propofol found on the victim, and incriminating messages sent to a woman friend, establishing motive and a confession.

title: Kohli chose to play 'easiest format'? Gill gives verdict on Manjrekar's comment
content: Manjrekar’s view that ODI cricket is the easiest format has led to mixed reactions, especially with a three-match ODI series against New Zealand set to begin in Baroda on Sunday, January 11. India captain Shubman Gill responded to the discussion by pointing out that results do not support the idea that any format is easy.

title: US strikes Syria: America bombs ISIS to avenge Palmyra ambush; what we know so far
content: The United States launched large-scale retaliatory strikes against Islamic State targets across Syria following a deadly ambush near Palmyra that killed two US soldiers and an interpreter. These strikes, part of Operation Hawkeye Strike, aim to prevent future attacks and degrade ISIS capabilities, sending a strong warning to the terrorist group.

title: 'USA ready to help': Trump warns Iran amid rising protests
content: The Trump administration is reportedly exploring options for a potential attack on Iran, including large-scale airstrikes, amid escalating tensions. President Trump has issued stern warnings to Tehran regarding its crackdown on protesters. While no concrete plans are finalized, discussions involve targeting specific sites. Iran's Supreme Leader has accused the US of interference.

title: 'Dhurandhar' day 37: Ranveer Singh film mints Rs 5.75 crore on Sat
content: Ranveer Singh's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' has enjoyed a dominant run, nearing Rs 800 crore domestically and over Rs 1200 crore globally. However, the film's reign is challenged by Prabhas's new release, 'The Raja Saab,' which has significantly outperformed 'Dhurandhar' in its opening days, signaling a shift in box office dominance.

title: 'Operation Hawkeye Strike': US carries out 'large-scale' airstrikes in Syria; targets ISIS
content: US and allied forces launched significant strikes across Syria targeting Islamic State positions. This decisive action, dubbed Operation Hawkeye Strike, serves as a direct retaliation for a recent deadly attack in Palmyra that claimed the lives of two American soldiers and a US civilian interpreter. CENTCOM vowed to pursue those responsible, emphasizing a zero-tolerance policy for attacks on their personnel.

title: 'Grateful Dead' guitarist Bob Weir passes away at 78 after battling cancer
content: Grateful Dead co-founder Bob Weir has passed away at 78 after a battle with cancer. His spokesperson confirmed his death, citing complications from lung issues. Weir, a guitarist and vocalist, was a guiding force in American music, building a lasting community through his artistry. He is remembered for his fiery spirit and a legacy intended to endure for centuries.

title: Bullets orphan 2 sisters in Delhi; Rachna Yadav was RWA president
content: Delhi is shaken by a heart-wrenching tragedy as Rachna Yadav, a prominent figure and beloved shop owner, is gunned down, echoing the sorrow of her husband’s murder two years earlier. This double loss leaves her daughters, Vrinda and Kanika, grappling with fear for their own safety while trying to process their parents' brutal deaths.

title: US shields Venezuelan oil revenue as Trump signs executive order
content: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order declaring a national emergency to safeguard Venezuelan oil revenue held in US accounts. This move aims to block creditors from seizing these funds, ensuring they are preserved for US foreign policy objectives and to promote stability in Venezuela. The order also prohibits transfers of these sovereign funds, superseding prior regulations.

title: IND vs NZ: Rishabh Pant ruled out of ODI series due to side strain injury
content: "He has been diagnosed with a right-sided strain with internal oblique muscle tear, and has thus been ruled out of the forthcoming ODI series against New Zealand," a reliable source told TOI. While KL Rahul is the regular wicketkeeper in India's ODI side, the selectors will soon announce a replacement for Pant.

title: Parking lot manager run over by Haryana tourists after fee dispute in Haridwar
content: A parking lot attendant in Haridwar was fatally run over by two men from Haryana after a dispute over parking fees. The incident occurred at the Deen Dayal Upadhyay parking facility, where the accused rammed their vehicle into the victim and fled. The victim succumbed to his critical injuries during treatment.

title: Communal Clashes Erupt In Tripura Over Fair Subscription, Internet Suspended
content: Tension flared between two communities in Tripuras Unakoti district following a dispute over the collection of subscriptions for a local fair, leaving at least five to six people injured and several houses gutted.

title: 'Iran Looking At Freedom Like Lever Before': Trump Vows US Support
content: President Donald Trump said Saturday that the United States is "ready to help" as protesters in Iran faced an intensifying crackdown by authorities of the Islamic republic.

title: US Launches Retaliatory Strikes Against Islamic State In Syria
content: The US has launched another round of retaliatory strikes against the Islamic State in Syria following last months ambush that killed two US soldiers and one American civilian interpreter in the country.

title: Video Shows Israeli Settlers Beating 64-Year-Old Palestinian Man In West Bank
content: A video circulating on social media shows dozens of masked men dressed in black hitting and kicking a man on the ground. Israeli settlers beat a 67-year-old man, Basim Saleh Yassin, as he was trying to flee a plant nursery in the West Bank.

title: Elderly Couple Duped Of Rs 14 Crore In Delhi In 'Digital Arrest' Scam: Cops
content: An elderly doctor couple residing in south Delhi's Greater Kailash was allegedly cheated of nearly Rs 14 crore after cybercriminals placed them under "digital arrest" for over two weeks, police said on Saturday.

title: 4 Dead, 30 Injured In Vehicle Collisions Due To Fog In North India
content: Cold conditions intensified in parts of north India on Saturday, with many parts blanketed by thick fog that led to several vehicle collisions, leaving four dead and about 30 injured.

title: 'Not All Kukis Are Enemies, But Illegal Immigration A Concern': Arambai Tenggol Chief
content: Meitei outfit Arambai Tenggol's chief Korou Nganba Khuman on Saturday said he does not view all Kukis as enemies, and is keen on peaceful coexistence.

title: Trump Signs Executive Order To Protect US-Held Money From Venezuela Oil
content: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order protecting US-held money derived from sales of Venezuelan oil, after the ouster of Nicolas Maduro, the White House said.

title: Protesters Put Pre-Islamic Revolution Iran Flag On London Embassy
content: A protester briefly replaced the flag of the Islamic Republic of Iran on its London embassy with the former flag, flown before 1979, during a demonstration Saturday.

title: Ethiopia Begins Construction Of Africa's Biggest Airport
content: Ethiopia on Saturday started building what the prime minister says will be Africa's biggest airport when completed in the town of Bishoftu, southeast of the capital Addis Ababa.

title: Lured With Jobs, Forced To Work For Scamsters In Myanmar, 27 Indians Rescued

title: Blog: Blog | Parasakthi Delivers A Fiery Political Statement

title: Greenland Parliament To Bring Forward Meeting To Discuss US Threats
content: Greenland's parliament will bring forward a meeting to discuss its response to US threats to take control of the Arctic island, the leaders of the five political parties in the Greenlandic assembly said in a joint statement.

title: 4 Oil Tankers That Left Venezuela In 'Dark Mode' Back In Its Waters
content: At least four tankers, most of them loaded, that had departed from Venezuela in early January in 'dark mode' - or with their transponders off amid a strict US blockade - are now back in the South American country's waters

title: Shady Loans, 'Missing' Rs 9-Crore Bentley: Businessman Arrested For Fraud

title: Preventive detention can't be to prolong custody: Supreme Court
content: if an accused commits fresh offence while on bail, it can be handled under ordinary law by seeking cancellation of bail or by challenging bail in higher courts . the court held "mere apprehension" that in the event of the detenu being released on bail would not be a sufficient ground to order her preventive detention .

title: Only 1 in 5 deaths in India medically certified: Study

Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. title: Transparent recruitment ended paper leak scandals of Congress era in Rajasthan: Shah
content: amit Shah credited the BJP-led govt in the state with streamlining the recruitment system . he said nearly 9,000 candidates were recruited, including over 2,500 women, and symbolically handed appointment letters to 10 constables . the home minister maintains that the recruitment process ensured transparency .

title: ‘Suspicious’ pigeon caught in forward village along LoC
content:
.

JAMMU: A suspicious pigeon, believed to be from Pakistan, was caught in a forward village near the LoC in Akhnoor sector of J&K on Saturday. The pigeon, caught in Kharah Balli village, was bearing coded markings, police said. The bird was first noticed by a 13-year-old boy, whose parents informed the police. “The pale grey pigeon is having red and yellow rings in legs inscribed with “Rehmat Sarkar” along with a mobile number and a name, followed by certain numbers, besides stamped wings,” police sources said. Additionally, a stamp was observed on the wings mentioning “Nowshera Aling Pigeon Club”, they said. Meanwhile, locals of Gorkha Nagar on Saturday noticed an object suspected to be a drone lying near a nallah in the area. Police have taken the object in custody for a detailed examination.

End of Article

title: 1st Isro launch of '26 will put another 'eye in the sky' tomorrow
content: the rocket will launch an advanced earth observation satellite EOS-N1 (code-named 'Anvesha') it will also be carrying a european demonstrator satellite and 17 other satellites belonging to Indian and foreign agencies . it will help India secure its borders and be used in fields like agriculture, urban mapping and environmental observation .

title: Police vehicle driver, 4 others gang-rape teen in Chhattisgarh

title: 🏈 CFB transfer portal: Teams off to hot starts
content: college football's offseason transfer window opened one week ago . a dozen FBS programs have secured commitments from 20 or more players in the portal . there are 10 programs off to impressive starts in building up their rosters for 2026 .

title: Follow live: Packers, Bears battling with divisional round spot on the line
content: The NFL's wild-card weekend kicked off Saturday with a wild one in Carolina, where the  Los Angeles Rams  hung on for a 34-31 victory over the Panthers. In the late window, the  Green Bay Packers  (9-7-1) visit the  Chicago Bears  (11-6) at 8 p.m. ET (Prime Video). The action continues with a trio of games Sunday: The  Buffalo Bills  (12-5) visit the  Jacksonville Jaguars  (13-4) at 1 p.m. ET (CBS); the  San Francisco 49ers  (12-5) are at the  Philadelphia Eagles  (11-6) at 4:30 p.m. ET (Fox); and the  New England Patriots  (11-6) host the  Los Angeles Chargers  (14-3)  at 8 p.m. ET (NBC). On Monday, the  Pittsburgh Steelers  (10-7) host the  Houston Texans  (12-5) at 8:15 p.m. ET (ESPN/ABC). Check out the top explosive plays and highlights from every wild-card game:
